nodes.title: BEN-10884 Complete GitHub Repositories ETL Phase 3 Implementation
nodes.body:
- Implemented complete GitHub repositories extraction worker with GitHub API integration
- Created transform worker for repository data processing and storage
- Implemented embedding worker for repository vectorization in Qdrant
- Added WebSocket real-time status updates for frontend progress tracking
- Implemented incremental sync using last_sync_date to prevent duplicates
- Added atomic race condition checks for job execution safety
- Created frontend UI components (GitHubJobDetailsModal.tsx, JobCard updates)
- Verified all Jira job functionality remains unaffected
- Tested end-to-end pipeline with multiple repositories
- Added proper error handling and logging throughout

Subtasks completed:
- BEN-10885: Implement GitHub Repositories ETL Pipeline
- BEN-10886: Implement GitHub Repositories Job - Backend & Frontend

Technical highlights:
- Follows exact same patterns as Jira job for consistency
- Uses queue-based architecture (Extract â†’ Transform â†’ Embed)
- Implements proper flag forwarding (first_item, last_item, last_job_item)
- Supports multi-tenant architecture with tenant_id isolation
- Integrates with existing WebSocket infrastructure
- Maintains database transaction isolation for data consistency

## Pull Request Overview This PR completes the GitHub Repositories ETL Phase 3 implementation by adding the full Extract â†’ Transform â†’ Embed pipeline for GitHub repositories. The implementation follows the same queue-based architecture and patterns established by the Jira job, ensuring consistency across the codebase. **Key Changes:** - Implemented GitHub repositories extraction worker with GitHub API integration and incremental sync - Created transform worker for repository data processing with proper UPSERT operations - Added embedding worker support for repository vectorization in Qdrant - Updated authentication handling to support both service-to-service and user JWT tokens - Enhanced JobCard countdown logic with server-time synchronization and exponential backoff ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 18 out of 21 changed files in this pull request and generated 4 comments.

services/backend-service/app/workers/transform_worker.py | Added GitHub repositories transform processing with proper flag forwarding | | services/backend-service/app/workers/extraction_worker.py | Added GitHub repositories extraction routing | | services/backend-service/app/workers/embedding_worker.py | Added repositories entity support in embedding worker with proper data fetching | | services/backend-service/app/models/unified_models.py | Updated Repository model with expanded field definitions | | services/backend-service/app/etl/jobs.py | Added GitHub job queuing support and hybrid authentication improvements | | services/backend-service/app/etl/job_scheduler.py | Updated scheduler to support GitHub jobs with proper status handling | | services/backend-service/app/etl/github_extraction.py | New file implementing complete GitHub repositories extraction logic | | services/backend-service/app/api/websocket_routes.py | Added token-based authentication to job WebSocket endpoints | | services/backend-service/app/api/ai_config_routes.py | Updated auth warning logging | | jira_get_projects_issuetypes.json | Removed test/sample data file | | docs/evolution_plans/etl_transformation/phase_4_github_prs_commits_reviews.md | Updated documentation with implementation patterns | | docs/evolution_plans/etl_transformation/completed/phase_3_github_repositories_recreation.md | Updated completed phase documentation |
--- ðŸ’¡ Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started.

The countdown interval makes an API call every second to fetch server time, which could create unnecessary load. Consider calculating remaining time locally after the initial server time fetch, and only query the server periodically (e.g., every 10 seconds) to correct for clock drift.

The topics field is stored as JSONB in the database (line 3894 in transform_worker.py converts it with `json.dumps()`), so it will be a string here, not a list. This will result in joining individual characters instead of topic names. Parse the JSON string first: `topics = json.loads(entity_data['topics']) if isinstance(entity_data['topics'], str) else entity_data['topics']`

The comment mentions httpx URL encoding, but the actual URL encoding happens later. The trailing hyphen handling logic seems incomplete - while the comment says to keep it as-is, there's code at lines 148-151 that strips trailing hyphens. Consider clarifying the intended behavior or removing one of these approaches.
```suggestion
                # Strip trailing hyphens from filter pattern for consistency with other logic
                cleaned_filter = filter_pattern.rstrip('-')
                search_patterns.append(f"{cleaned_filter} in:name")
```

The jsonb_set operation should use double quotes for the JSON string value. Change `to_jsonb('FAILED'::text)` to `'\"FAILED\"'::jsonb` to ensure proper JSON formatting, consistent with line 631 where it's done correctly.

commit.message:
Fix ETL job card display names and step ordering

- Add order and display_name fields to StepWorkerStatus model
- Update worker status API to return complete step metadata
- Fix frontend ETL service to use correct API URL and authentication
- Update migrations to include display_name and order for all job types
- Ensure GitHub jobs show their own steps (not Jira's)
- Enable proper step ordering (1,2,3,4) in UI
- Make step names dynamic and database-driven

Job-specific steps now working:
- Jira: Projects & Types, Statuses & Relations, Issues & Changelogs, Development Status
- GitHub: Repositories, Pull Requests, Commits, Reviews
- WEX: Fabric Data, AD Users

Fix ETL worker status timing issues and queue message flag handling

- Fix dev_status extraction worker setting status to 'running' immediately on first_item=true
- Fix transform worker setting status to 'running' and 'finished' properly for dev_status
- Fix queue manager to always include first_item/last_item/last_job_item flags in messages
- Update ETL.md documentation with standardized message structure examples
- Remove test files from root directory

This resolves timing issues where transform workers would show 'running' before extraction workers started, ensuring proper status progression: extraction->transform->embedding.

Replace outdated GitHub ETL evolution plans with new queue-based architecture

- Remove phase_3_github_enhancement.md and phase_4_testing_production.md (outdated)
- Add phase_3_github_repositories_recreation.md: GitHub repository discovery using new ETL architecture
  * Repository job integration with etl_jobs table
  * Extract->Transform->Embedding pipeline for repositories
  * WebSocket status updates and queue-based processing
  * Configuration-driven repository filtering + work_items_prs_links discovery
- Add phase_4_github_prs_commits_reviews.md: GitHub PR/commit/review processing with GraphQL
  * Multi-step job structure (PRs->Commits->Reviews->Comments)
  * GraphQL API integration with checkpoint recovery
  * Queue-based processing for all GitHub entity types
  * Real-time WebSocket updates for all processing stages

These new plans align with the current ETL architecture using RabbitMQ queues, worker status updates, and the same patterns established in Jira processing.

## Pull Request Overview This PR refactors the WebSocket-based real-time job progress monitoring system to track worker-specific status (extraction, transform, embedding) per ETL step, replacing the legacy percentage-based progress tracking with a more granular JSON-based status structure in the database. **Key Changes:** - Migrated from simple string-based job status to JSONB structure tracking individual worker states per step - Implemented hybrid approach combining WebSocket real-time updates with API fallback for reliability - Added per-step worker status tracking with proper first_item/last_item/last_job_item flag handling throughout the ETL pipeline - Removed legacy progress tracking code and WebSocket progress update methods ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 49 out of 49 changed files in this pull request and generated 5 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | services/frontend-etl/src/services/etlWebSocketService.ts | Complete rewrite to support worker-specific status tracking per job with hybrid WebSocket/API approach | | services/frontend-etl/src/components/JobCard.tsx | Updated to display per-step worker status indicators instead of progress bars | | services/backend-service/app/models/unified_models.py | Changed etl_jobs.status column from VARCHAR to JSONB for structured worker status | | services/backend-service/app/workers/extraction_worker.py | Added worker status updates and proper message flag handling | | services/backend-service/app/workers/transform_worker.py | Added worker status updates and completion message handling | | services/backend-service/app/workers/embedding_worker.py | Added worker status updates and job completion logic | | services/backend-service/app/etl/jobs.py | Added new endpoints for worker status queries and job reset | | services/backend-service/scripts/migrations/*.py | Updated seed data to include JSONB status structure |

commit.message:
fix: Remove custom_fields_overflow column and fix ETL transform worker issues

- Remove custom_fields_overflow JSONB column from work_items table migration
- Remove custom_fields_overflow from SQLAlchemy unified models
- Remove custom_fields_overflow from frontend TypeScript types
- Remove GIN index for custom_fields_overflow from migration
- Update transform worker to use configurable development field from .env
- Fix job_id parameter passing in dev_status processing methods
- Fix SQL syntax error in error handling (use CAST instead of :: syntax)
- Remove overflow field collection logic from _extract_all_fields method
- Update documentation to remove custom_fields_overflow references
- Simplify custom fields architecture to use only 20 dedicated columns

Benefits:
- Faster database performance without JSON column queries
- Smaller database size without storing unused fields
- Focused data model storing only mapped custom fields
- Simpler maintenance without complex JSON handling

refactor: Remove deprecated and unused code from pre-queue architecture

HIGH PRIORITY REMOVALS:
- Replace direct transform worker calls with proper queue publishing in jira_extraction.py
- Remove optional queue transformation logic in raw_data.py (always queue now)

MEDIUM PRIORITY REMOVALS:
- Remove OrchestratorControl.tsx and OrchestratorSettingsModal.tsx components
- Remove legacy websocketService.ts (replaced by sessionWebSocketService.ts)
- Update imports in JobCard.tsx and AuthContext.tsx to use sessionWebSocketService

LOW PRIORITY REMOVALS:
- Remove deprecated token refresh logic in etlApiService.ts (auth service handles this)
- Simplify 401 error handling to immediate logout

ARCHITECTURE IMPROVEMENTS:
- Enforce queue-based architecture throughout ETL pipeline
- Remove synchronous processing patterns that bypass workers
- Maintain clean separation between extraction, transform, and load phases
- Keep AD and Fabric modal components as requested

Note: etl-service directory preserved as backup/reference as requested

fix: Update remaining websocketService import in HomePage.tsx

- Replace import from deleted websocketService.ts with sessionWebSocketService.ts
- Fixes Vite build error: Failed to resolve import '../services/websocketService'
- All websocketService imports now properly updated to sessionWebSocketService

fix: Create new ETL WebSocket service to replace deleted websocketService

PROBLEM:
- Deleted websocketService.ts but code still imported etlWebSocketService from it
- Caused runtime error: module does not provide export named 'etlWebSocketService'

SOLUTION:
- Created new dedicated etlWebSocketService.ts with all required methods:
  * initializeService(token) - Initialize with auth token
  * connectToJob(jobName, handlers) - Connect to specific job progress
  * disconnectAll() - Disconnect all connections
  * updateToken(newToken) - Update auth token
  * getInitializationVersion() - Track service restarts
  * handleJobToggle(jobName, active) - Manage job activation

FEATURES:
- Real-time job progress updates (percentage, current step)
- Job status changes (RUNNING, COMPLETED, FAILED)
- Automatic reconnection with exponential backoff
- Per-job connection management
- Authentication token support
- Service restart detection

UPDATED IMPORTS:
- AuthContext.tsx: Use new etlWebSocketService
- JobCard.tsx: Use new etlWebSocketService with proper types
- HomePage.tsx: Use new etlWebSocketService

This restores ETL job progress monitoring functionality that was lost when websocketService.ts was deleted.

fix: Resolve ETL WebSocket service initialization timing issue

PROBLEM:
- JobCard components mount before etlWebSocketService.initializeService() completes
- Service shows 'initialized (version 1)' but connectToJob fails with 'Service not initialized'
- Race condition between async service initialization and component mounting

SOLUTION:
1. Added isReady() method to check service initialization status
2. Added retry mechanism in JobCard with 100ms delays (up to 1 second total)
3. Added proper shutdown() method for clean service termination
4. Updated AuthContext to use shutdown() instead of disconnectAll() on logout

TECHNICAL DETAILS:
- etlWebSocketService.isReady() checks both isInitialized flag and token presence
- JobCard.connectWithRetry() attempts connection up to 10 times with 100ms intervals
- Service initialization now properly sets isInitialized flag after clearing connections
- Proper cleanup function returned even during retry attempts

This ensures WebSocket connections establish successfully after login without timing issues.

fix: Update ETL WebSocket service to use correct backend-service endpoints

PROBLEM:
- ETL WebSocket service was trying to connect to non-existent endpoint
- URL: /ws/etl/job/{jobName} (doesn't exist on backend-service)
- Caused WebSocket connection failures and errors

SOLUTION:
- Updated WebSocket URL to match backend-service endpoint: /ws/progress/{jobName}
- Fixed message format to match backend-service WebSocket messages:
  * Progress: {type: 'progress', job: jobName, percentage, step, timestamp}
  * Status: {type: 'status', job: jobName, status, message, timestamp}
  * Completion: {type: 'completion', job: jobName, success, summary, timestamp}
- Added pong message handling for ping/pong keepalive
- Updated interface to use 'job' field instead of 'job_name'

BACKEND ENDPOINT:
- Backend-service WebSocket: ws://localhost:3001/ws/progress/{jobName}?token={token}
- Supports tenant isolation and authentication
- Provides real-time ETL job progress monitoring

This should now successfully connect to backend-service WebSocket endpoints for real-time ETL job progress updates.

fix: Improve ETL WebSocket service - remove logs and fix React StrictMode errors

IMPROVEMENTS:
1. Remove connection success logs - no longer needed in production
2. Fix React StrictMode development errors:
   - Prevent duplicate connections by checking existing connection state
   - Use close code 1001 (going away) to prevent unnecessary reconnection attempts
   - Only log errors when WebSocket is not already closed
   - Handle React StrictMode double-mounting gracefully

TECHNICAL CHANGES:
- Check for existing OPEN connections before creating new ones
- Use WebSocket close code 1001 for manual disconnects (prevents reconnection)
- Filter out error logs from already-closed WebSockets
- Improved cleanup handling for React development mode

RESULT:
- Clean console output in both development and production
- No more 'WebSocket is closed before connection established' errors
- Proper connection management in React StrictMode
- Maintains all real-time functionality

fix: Resolve ETL WebSocket service errors and missing job_id parameter

PROBLEMS FIXED:

1. ETL WebSocket Service Errors:
   - Fixed React StrictMode causing duplicate WebSocket connections
   - Added wsConnectionRef to track connections and prevent double mounting
   - Fixed invalid WebSocket close code (1001 â†’ 1000)
   - Added try-catch in disconnectAll() to handle connection cleanup gracefully
   - Removed service initialization logs to clean up console output

2. ETL Jira Extraction Error:
   - Fixed NameError: name 'job_id' is not defined in _extract_statuses_and_relationships
   - Changed etl_job_id=job_id to etl_job_id=progress_tracker.job_id
   - JiraExtractionProgressTracker stores job_id as instance attribute

TECHNICAL CHANGES:

WebSocket Service (etlWebSocketService.ts):
- Added wsConnectionRef in JobCard to prevent React StrictMode double connections
- Fixed disconnectJob() and disconnectAll() to only close OPEN WebSockets
- Added try-catch blocks to handle cleanup errors silently
- Removed console.log for service initialization

Jira Extraction (jira_extraction.py):
- Fixed queue_manager.publish_transform_job() call to use progress_tracker.job_id
- Ensures ETL job tracking works correctly through the queue system

RESULTS:
- Clean WebSocket connections without console errors
- ETL custom fields extraction works without job_id errors
- Real-time progress updates function properly
- React StrictMode compatibility in development
several fixes

nodes.body:
## Pull Request Overview This PR implements a WebSocket-based queue status display feature for real-time ETL job progress monitoring. The changes refactor the WebSocket service architecture and remove deprecated custom field overflow functionality from the database schema. Key changes: - Replaced the old `websocketService.ts` with a new, streamlined `etlWebSocketService.ts` that provides cleaner connection management and better React StrictMode compatibility - Added visual queue stage tracking (extraction, transform, embedding) to the JobCard UI component - Removed `custom_fields_overflow` column from the database schema and related code, simplifying the custom fields architecture to use only the 20 dedicated columns ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 22 out of 23 changed files in this pull request and generated 7 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | services/frontend-etl/src/services/etlWebSocketService.ts | New WebSocket service implementation with simplified connection management and queue tracking support | | services/frontend-etl/src/services/websocketService.ts | Old WebSocket service removed (replaced by etlWebSocketService) | | services/frontend-etl/src/components/JobCard.tsx | Added queue stage visualization and updated to use new WebSocket service | | services/backend-service/app/workers/transform_worker.py | Updated to handle individual issue processing and removed custom_fields_overflow logic | | services/backend-service/app/etl/jira_extraction.py | Changed to queue individual issues instead of batches and use proper queue architecture | | services/backend-service/app/models/unified_models.py | Removed custom_fields_overflow column from WorkItem model | | services/backend-service/scripts/migrations/0001_initial_db_schema.py | Removed custom_fields_overflow column creation and index | | services/frontend-etl/src/types/index.ts | Removed custom_fields_overflow field from WorkItem interface | | services/frontend-etl/src/services/etlApiService.ts | Simplified 401 error handling (removed inline token refresh logic) | | services/frontend-etl/src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx | Updated to use new shutdown() method instead of disconnectAll() | | services/backend-service/app/api/auth_routes.py | Increased timeout values and added better error handling for heavy ETL operations | | services/backend-service/app/etl/raw_data.py | Removed queue_transform parameter (always queue) and improved error logging | | services/backend-service/app/core/logging_config.py | Enhanced log filtering to capture ETL debug messages |
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

The property `data.success` does not exist on `CompletionUpdate` interface. According to the interface definition, `CompletionUpdate` has `status: string` and `message: string`, but no `success` boolean property. This will cause a runtime error. Use `data.status === 'COMPLETED'` instead.

The comment states '*all' will fetch all fields, but this is incorrect. The Jira API uses the literal string '*all' (not an array with that string) or the value `None` to fetch all fields. An array containing the string '*all' will be treated as a request for a field named '*all', which likely doesn't exist. Either use `fields = '*all'` or `fields = None`.
```suggestion
    # Use None to fetch all fields (Jira API convention)
    fields = None  # This will fetch all fields
```

This change modifies work_items to use 'external_id' instead of 'key', but the comment on line 1747 still says 'key'. For work_items, the external_id is typically the issue key (e.g., 'BEN-9649'), so using 'external_id' is correct, but this assumes the entity dict has been populated with 'external_id'. Verify that work_items entities have 'external_id' populated, or this will result in None values.
```suggestion
                    external_id = entity.get('external_id') or entity.get('key')
```

The recursive retry logic does not properly return the cleanup function from the delayed retry attempt. When the retry succeeds after the timeout, the actual cleanup function from `etlWebSocketService.connectToJob()` is never returned or stored. This means the connection won't be cleaned up properly when the component unmounts during the retry period. Store the result of the setTimeout and provide a cleanup that cancels the timeout if needed.

The comment is inconsistent with the actual value. Line 1468 sets `fields = ['*all']`, not `None`. Update the comment to match: `# ['*all'] = fetch all fields` or fix the fields variable as mentioned in a previous comment.
```suggestion
            fields=fields,  # ['*all'] = fetch all fields
```

The filter includes 'DEBOGA' which appears to be a temporary debug string (see removal in extraction_worker.py line 320-321). This should be removed from the logging filter as it's no longer used in the codebase.
```suggestion
            "ðŸ“¨", "ðŸ”", "ðŸ“‹", "âœ… Jira extraction job queued", "âŒ Failed to publish"
```

The docstring on lines 108-112 still mentions 'optionally queue for transformation' and references the removed `queue_transform` parameter. Update the docstring to reflect that transformation is always queued now.

commit.message:
Update custom fields page button to match other mapping pages

- Changed button text from 'Sync from Jira' to 'Queue for Extraction & Transform'
- Updated icon from Download to cube/package icon (same as other mapping pages)
- Fixed loading state to use Loader2 spinner instead of spinning Download icon
- Updated loading text from 'Syncing from Jira...' to 'Queueing...'
- Updated all related text, tooltips, error messages, and success messages
- Updated ETL.md documentation to reflect new button name
- Button now visually and functionally matches Queue for Embedding buttons on other mapping pages

Fix ETL job silent failures and database locks

- Fix missing SQLAlchemy text imports in jira_extraction.py
  - Add text import in _extract_projects_and_issue_types function
  - Add text import in _extract_statuses_and_relationships function
  - Add text import for projects fallback query
- Remove redundant job status update in _queue_jira_extraction_job
  - Prevents duplicate RUNNING status updates causing database locks
  - Job status now only set once in run_job_now function
- Resolves silent ETL job failures and frontend hanging issues

commit.message:
BEN-10438 Rename worker_config to worker_configs and remove worker_scale column

- Renamed table from worker_config to worker_configs (plural, consistent naming)
- Removed unnecessary worker_scale column (was auto-calculated, not needed)
- Updated WorkerConfig model to inherit from BaseEntity with proper column order
- Fixed unique constraint name to match table name (unique_tenant_worker_configs)

Migration changes:
- Migration 0001: Schema only, removed data INSERT, fixed column order
- Migrations 0002/0003/0004: Added worker_configs INSERT after tenant creation
- Updated all rollback functions to delete worker_configs data

Code updates:
- Updated unified_models.py: WorkerConfig model with new table name
- Updated worker_manager.py: Use worker_configs table
- Updated admin_routes.py: Removed worker_scale from API responses
- Updated QueueManagementPage.tsx: Removed worker_scale from UI

Final schema: worker_configs table with id, transform_workers, vectorization_workers, tenant_id, active, created_at, last_updated_at

Fix WorkerConfig class definition order - move after BaseEntity

- Moved WorkerConfig class definition after BaseEntity (was causing NameError)
- Removed duplicate relationships from WorkerConfig (they belong to Tenant)
- WorkerConfig now properly inherits from BaseEntity

Fix TypeScript syntax error in QueueManagementPage - try: to try {

- Changed Python-style 'try:' to JavaScript-style 'try {' in fetchWorkerLogs function

Fix worker config selectors resetting on auto-refresh

- Added updateLocalState parameter to fetchWorkerConfig (default false)
- Only update local state on initial load and after successful save
- Auto-refresh (every 10s) no longer resets user's selections
- Apply button now works correctly when values differ from saved config

Add tabbed interface to Queue Management page

- Added Tabs component with Overview and Configuration tabs
- Overview tab: Worker status, controls, queue stats, and raw data stats
- Configuration tab: Worker scale configuration and worker logs
- Improved organization and separation of monitoring vs configuration
- Added Settings icon to Configuration tab for better visual clarity

Add Tabs UI component for frontend-etl

- Created tabs.tsx component using Radix UI primitives
- Installed @radix-ui/react-tabs package
- Follows same pattern as other UI components (button, card, etc.)
- Supports Tabs, TabsList, TabsTrigger, and TabsContent exports

Add code_changed column to work_items table

- Added code_changed BOOLEAN column to work_items table in migration 0001
- Updated WorkItem model to include code_changed column
- Changed story_points from INTEGER to FLOAT for decimal support
- Reorganized column order in model to match migration schema
- Removed duplicate priority and parent_external_id columns in model

This fixes the transform worker error when processing Jira issues with code_changed custom field mapping.

Replace Radix UI Tabs with custom tab implementation to match mappings page

- Removed Radix UI Tabs component usage
- Implemented custom tab buttons with border-bottom styling
- Matches the exact styling from MappingsPage (border-b-2, hover effects)
- Uses conditional rendering instead of TabsContent components
- Consistent tab design across all ETL frontend pages

Move Worker Controls and Worker Logs to Overview tab

- Moved Worker Controls card from Configuration to Overview tab
- Moved Recent Worker Logs card from Configuration to Overview tab
- Configuration tab now only contains Worker Scale Configuration
- Better organization: monitoring/controls in Overview, settings in Configuration
- Worker logs are fetched from log files on disk (logs/workers.log, logs/backend_service_system.log)

Improve worker configuration UX with better Apply button visibility and restart workflow

- Show Apply button only when configuration differs from saved values
- Hide Apply button when values match current config (show checkmark message instead)
- Add confirmation modal after applying config asking if user wants to restart workers
- Auto-trigger restart if user confirms in the modal
- Update Important Notes to clarify two-step process: 1) Apply config, 2) Restart workers
- Make it clear that workers do NOT start automatically when config is applied
- Improve Apply button styling and show worker counts in button text

Make Apply button always visible (disabled when no changes)

- Changed from conditionally showing/hiding Apply button to always showing it
- Button is disabled when configuration matches current settings
- Shows helper text below button when values match
- Better UX: users can always see the Apply button location

Add URL parameter support for tabs and improve Apply button visibility

- Added useSearchParams to persist active tab in URL (like MappingsPage)
- URL updates when switching tabs: ?tab=overview or ?tab=configuration
- Page refresh now maintains the active tab
- Document title updates based on active tab
- Made Apply button more prominent with blue background and larger padding
- Added debug info in development mode to troubleshoot button visibility
- Added console logging when Apply button is clicked
- Improved visual feedback with green background for 'no changes' message

Add prominent Apply button at top of Configuration tab (like mappings pages)

- Added header section with Apply button at the top of Configuration tab
- Matches the pattern from WIT Hierarchies and other mapping pages
- Apply button is always visible at the top right
- Added status indicator showing 'Saved' (green) or 'Unsaved Changes' (orange)
- Removed duplicate title/description from card header
- Button includes checkmark icon and proper disabled states
- Much easier to find and use than the previous bottom-only button

Match Custom Fields page button style and toast messages

- Changed Apply button to match exact style from CustomFieldMappingPage
- Button now uses table header container with bg-table-header
- Changed button text from 'Apply Configuration' to 'Save Configuration'
- Removed status indicator (Saved/Unsaved Changes)
- Removed disabled state - button is always enabled like Custom Fields page
- Added toast notifications using useToast hook
- Success toast: 'Configuration Saved' with message about restarting workers
- Error toast: 'Save Failed' with error details
- Removed duplicate Apply button at bottom of card
- Removed debug info
- Added ToastContainer at end of component
- Matches the exact pattern from all mapping pages

Fix ToastContainer placement - move inside return statement

- Fixed syntax error: ToastContainer was outside return statement
- Moved ToastContainer inside the main div but after the layout
- Now properly renders toast notifications

Add top margin to card content for better spacing

- Added pt-6 (padding-top) to CardContent
- Provides better visual spacing between header and content
- Matches the spacing pattern from other mapping pages

Replace window.confirm with ConfirmationModal for restart prompt

- Replaced window.confirm alert with ConfirmationModal component
- Uses useConfirmation hook for consistent modal behavior
- Modal matches the inactive/active confirmation pattern from other pages
- Better UX with proper modal styling and backdrop
- Confirmation type is 'info' (blue) for restart action
- Confirm button text: 'Restart Workers'
- Modal title: 'Restart Workers?'
- Modal message explains that changes require restart to take effect

Update Worker Status display for multiple workers per type

- Updated WorkerStatus interface to match new multi-worker data structure
- Added WorkerInstance and WorkerTypeStatus interfaces
- Transform workers now show count and individual instances (e.g., '3 / 5 Running')
- Vectorization workers now show count and individual instances
- Each worker type displayed in colored card (blue for transform, purple for vectorization)
- Shows individual worker status (Worker 1, Worker 2, etc.)
- Displays running count vs total count for each worker type
- Removed old single-worker display logic
- Better visual organization with separate sections for each worker type

Update Worker Status for multi-worker display and remove Worker Logs section

Worker Status Updates:
- Updated WorkerStatus interface to match new multi-worker data structure
- Added WorkerInstance and WorkerTypeStatus interfaces
- Transform workers now show count and individual instances (e.g., '3 / 5 Running')
- Vectorization workers now show count and individual instances
- Each worker type displayed in colored card (blue for transform, purple for vectorization)
- Shows individual worker status (Worker 1, Worker 2, etc.)
- Displays running count vs total count for each worker type
- Removed old single-worker display logic

Worker Controls:
- Controls already handle multi-worker configuration correctly
- Start/Stop/Restart actions work for all workers of the tenant
- Backend properly starts/stops all configured workers (1-10 per type)

Worker Logs Removal:
- Removed Worker Logs section (not displaying useful information)
- Removed WorkerLogs interface
- Removed fetchWorkerLogs function
- Removed workerLogs state
- Removed logs from auto-refresh interval
- Cleaner UI focused on worker status and controls

Move Worker Controls to top of Overview tab

- Moved Worker Controls card to the top of the Overview tab
- Now appears before Worker Status and Queue Statistics cards
- Better UX: primary actions (Start/Stop/Restart) are immediately visible
- Removed duplicate Worker Controls card from bottom
- Layout: Worker Controls â†’ Worker Status + Queue Statistics grid â†’ Raw Data Statistics

Fix Qdrant race condition and database cursor error

Issue 1: Qdrant Collection Race Condition
- Created qdrant_setup.py to initialize all collections at startup
- Similar pattern to RabbitMQ queue initialization
- Creates collections for all active tenants on service startup
- Prevents 409 Conflict errors when multiple workers try to create same collection
- Updated qdrant_client.py to handle 'already exists' gracefully (log as DEBUG not ERROR)
- Added initialize_qdrant_collections() call in main.py startup sequence
- Collections created: tenant_{id}_{type} for all COLLECTION_TYPES
- Collection types: work_items, changelogs, projects, prs, prs_comments, prs_reviews, prs_commits, repositories, wits_hierarchies, wits_mappings, statuses_mappings, workflows, custom_fields_mappings

Issue 2: Database Cursor Already Closed Error
- Fixed jira_extraction.py cursor error in _extract_issues_with_changelogs_for_complete_job
- Problem: result.fetchone() was called after db.commit() but before finally block closed connection
- Solution: Fetch raw_data_id BEFORE commit to avoid cursor being closed
- Prevents psycopg2.InterfaceError: cursor already closed

Benefits:
- No more race conditions during vectorization
- Cleaner logs (no ERROR for expected concurrent creation)
- More reliable database operations
- Startup initialization ensures all collections exist before workers start

Fix: Database session management, cross-service auth, and ETL worker improvements

- Fixed all deprecated database session calls (30+ instances across 11 files)
  - Replaced get_session_context() with get_read_session_context() for reads
  - Replaced get_session_context() with get_write_session_context() for writes
  - Proper read/write separation for optimal connection pool usage

- Fixed ETL progress bar jumping backwards
  - Fixed hardcoded step index in complete_step() call
  - Fixed step progress ranges to start at 0.0 instead of 0.2
  - Progress now flows smoothly: 0% â†’ 33% â†’ 67% â†’ 100%

- Fixed job scheduler re-triggering finished jobs
  - Added status checks to only trigger jobs in READY status
  - Prevents race conditions during FINISHED â†’ READY transitions

- Fixed cross-service authentication between frontend-app and etl-frontend
  - Added axios.defaults.withCredentials = true to both frontends
  - Optimized checkExistingSession() to check cookie first before API call
  - Faster auto-login when switching between services

- Fixed admin routes junction table counting
  - Handle projects_wits and projects_statuses composite primary keys
  - Use count() instead of count(id) for tables without id column

- Fixed transform worker dev_status processing
  - Mark raw_extraction_data as completed after processing
  - Mark as failed with error details on exceptions
  - Prevents pending records from accumulating

- Fixed logout error
  - Added missing settings initialization in auth_routes.py

- UI improvements
  - Adjusted ETL frontend header padding for icon alignment
  - Matches frontend-app header layout

nodes.body:
## Pull Request Overview This PR implements a comprehensive database session management optimization and improves ETL architecture with a shift to tier-based worker pools. The key changes focus on preventing UI blocking during ETL jobs and implementing real-time session synchronization across multiple browser tabs and services. - Database session optimization with read/write session separation and connection pooling improvements - Migration from per-tenant workers to shared tier-based worker pools for better scalability - Session WebSocket service for real-time logout/theme synchronization across tabs and services ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 83 out of 86 changed files in this pull request and generated 5 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | `services/frontend-etl/src/services/websocketService.ts` | Enhanced WebSocket handling with React StrictMode compatibility and improved reconnection logic | | `services/frontend-etl/src/services/sessionWebSocketService.ts` | New real-time session synchronization service for cross-tab/device communication | | `services/backend-service/app/workers/worker_manager.py` | Complete rewrite to tier-based shared worker pools for better scalability | | `services/backend-service/app/workers/transform_worker.py` | Enhanced with special field processing and development field auto-mapping | | `services/backend-service/scripts/migrations/0001_initial_db_schema.py` | Updated schema with tier-based tenant configuration and enhanced work_items fields | | `services/frontend-etl/src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx` | Improved session validation, token refresh logic, and WebSocket integration |
Files not reviewed (1) * **services/frontend-etl/package-lock.json**: Language not supported
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

The condition `this.ws?.readyState === WebSocket.CLOSED` in line 83 will always be true when onclose is called, making the check redundant. Consider removing this condition or checking a different state.
```suggestion
        const isStrictModeClose = event.code === 1006
```

The docstring uses TypeScript-style type annotation syntax (WorkerManager:) instead of Python docstring format. Should use 'Returns: WorkerManager instance' or proper rST format.
```suggestion
        The singleton worker manager instance.
```
The import statement should be moved to the top of the file rather than being inside a method. This improves readability and follows Python import conventions.
The tier values are hardcoded in the CHECK constraint. Consider using a configuration constant or enum to ensure consistency with the TIER_WORKER_COUNTS definition in WorkerManager.
The magic number 180000 (3 minutes in milliseconds) should be extracted to a named constant for better maintainability and clarity.

## Pull Request Overview This is a comprehensive UI/UX improvement PR that focuses on frontend consistency, ETL service renaming, visual enhancements, and WebSocket fixes. The main goal is to create a more cohesive and professional user experience across both frontend applications. - Renamed `etl-frontend` to `frontend-etl` for consistent naming convention throughout the codebase - Synchronized UI styling between frontend-app and frontend-etl with consistent hover effects and card shadows - Fixed WebSocket connections to use correct ports and disabled auto-connect for unimplemented endpoints ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 65 out of 135 changed files in this pull request and generated 3 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | services/frontend-etl/tailwind.config.js | Added standardized box shadow configuration for consistent card styling | | services/frontend-etl/src/services/websocketService.ts | Improved WebSocket error handling and connection management | | services/frontend-etl/src/pages/*.tsx | Added embedded mode support and vectorization queue functionality to mapping pages | | services/frontend-etl/src/index.css | Updated card styling and border colors for consistent theme support | | services/frontend-etl/src/components/*.tsx | Enhanced hover effects and theme-aware styling | | services/frontend-app/src/services/websocketService.ts | Fixed WebSocket port configuration and added connection status comments | | services/frontend-app/src/pages/*.tsx | Removed deprecated engineering analytics pages | | services/frontend-app/src/components/*.tsx | Updated DORA page styling and hover effects | | services/backend-service/app/workers/vectorization_worker.py | Added support for mapping tables in vectorization worker | | services/backend-service/app/etl/*.py | Added vectorization queue endpoints and Qdrant activation fixes | | docs/* | Updated documentation to reflect etl-frontend â†’ frontend-etl rename |
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

Hard-coded border color should use CSS variable for consistency with theme system. Consider using `theme === 'dark' ? '#4a5568' : '#9ca3af'` to match the pattern used elsewhere in the codebase.
```suggestion
                      e.currentTarget.style.borderColor = (window.matchMedia && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) ? '#4a5568' : '#9ca3af'
```

The background color for inactive jobs is hard-coded. Consider using CSS variables or theme-aware color calculations for better maintainability and theme consistency.
```suggestion
        backgroundColor: !job.active ? 'var(--inactive-job-bg)' : undefined,
```
The logo filter logic duplicates theme-aware styling patterns. Consider extracting this into a utility function or CSS class to reduce code duplication across components.

commit.message:
Clean up backend-service scripts directory

- Removed all test and check scripts as requested
- Kept only migration_runner.py and migrations/ folder
- Deleted: check_*, test_*, debug_*, fix_*, start_*, trigger_*, validate_* scripts
- Deleted: load_testing/, ml_analysis/, ml_training/, worker_management/ directories
- Cleaned up __pycache__ directories
- Maintained essential migration infrastructure
Fix JiraAPIClient method name in extraction - Changed get_projects_with_issue_types() to get_projects() - Fixes AttributeError when job runs automatically

Fix missing hierarchy_level and description in WIT processing

- Added hierarchy_level and description fields when processing issue types from project/search API
- Both insert and update operations now include these required fields
- Fixes NotNullViolation error: null value in column hierarchy_level of relation wits
- Ensures data consistency between different processing methods

Remove duplicate ETL job log messages

- Removed duplicate start/finish/fail logs from jira_extraction.py
- Kept logs only in job_scheduler.py (the orchestrator)
- Prevents duplicate console output for job execution events
- Maintains detailed extraction-specific logs for debugging

Rename wits_prs_links to work_items_prs_links and improve Custom Fields Mapping UI

- Renamed table from wits_prs_links to work_items_prs_links (WIT = Work Item Types was incorrect, should be Work Items)
- Updated SQLAlchemy model: WitPrLinks -> WorkItemPrLink
- Updated all migrations (0001-0004) with new table name, indexes, constraints, and rollback statements
- Updated all imports and references across backend-service (admin_routes, dora_routes, ai_config_routes, qdrant.py)
- Updated all SQL queries and ORM relationships to use new naming

Custom Fields Mapping UI improvements:
- Redesigned from grid of cards to clean table layout for better UX
- All 20 mappings visible at once with alternating row colors
- Shows field type and Jira field ID inline for better context
- Simplified color scheme (removed colorful badges)
- Replaced emoji with Lucide FileText icon in empty state
- Improved readability and professional appearance

Implement queue-based vectorization architecture for ETL pipeline (BEN-10553)

Complete implementation of RabbitMQ-based vectorization system to replace database queue approach:

Queue Infrastructure:
- Updated QueueManager to support vectorization queues (vectorization_queue_tenant_{id})
- Added publish_vectorization_job() method for publishing vectorization messages
- setup_queues() now creates both transform and vectorization queues per tenant
- Lightweight message format: {tenant_id, table_name, external_id, operation}

Vectorization Worker (NEW):
- Created VectorizationWorker class following BaseWorker pattern
- Consumes from tenant-specific vectorization queues
- Fetches entities from database using external_id (or internal ID for work_items_prs_links)
- Replicates entity data preparation logic from old ETL (_prepare_entity_data)
- Generates embeddings using HybridProviderManager with tenant's embedding integration
- Stores vectors in Qdrant with collection naming: client_{tenant_id}_{table_name}
- Creates bridge records in qdrant_vectors table for Postgres â†” Qdrant mapping
- Supports all entity types: work_items, changelogs, projects, statuses, wits, prs, prs_commits, prs_reviews, prs_comments, repositories, work_items_prs_links

Transform Worker Integration:
- Added _queue_entities_for_vectorization() helper method
- Publishes vectorization messages after bulk insert/update operations
- Queues projects and wits for vectorization after processing
- Non-blocking: vectorization errors don't fail transform operations

Worker Manager Updates:
- start_tenant_workers() now starts both transform and vectorization workers per tenant
- stop_tenant_workers() stops both worker types
- Updated worker status tracking for both worker types

Technical Details:
- Batch size: 5 items (matching old ETL)
- Point ID logic: external_id for most tables, table_name_{id} for work_items_prs_links
- Auto-creates Qdrant collections if they don't exist
- UPSERT logic for qdrant_vectors bridge table to handle duplicates
- Proper datetime serialization for entity data

Benefits:
- Parallel processing: transform and vectorization run independently
- Scalable: tenant-specific queues enable horizontal scaling
- Resilient: RabbitMQ message persistence and retry logic
- Clean separation: transform completes fast, vectorization runs async

Refactor VectorizationWorker to use backend/ai infrastructure and mark old queue functions as deprecated

Phase 1: Update VectorizationWorker to use existing backend/ai components
- Updated _generate_embedding() to use HybridProviderManager.generate_embeddings()
  * Uses create_text_content_from_entity() helper (same as old ETL)
  * Async wrapper for HybridProviderManager initialization and embedding generation
  * Returns first embedding from batch response
- Updated _store_in_qdrant() to use PulseQdrantClient (same as old ETL)
  * Uses ensure_collection_exists() for auto-collection creation
  * Uses upsert_vectors() with same vector data format as old ETL
  * Async wrapper for Qdrant operations
- Updated _get_point_id() to generate deterministic UUIDs (same as old ETL)
  * Uses uuid.uuid5() with NAMESPACE_DNS for consistency
  * Format: uuid5(tenant_id_table_name_record_id)
  * Ensures same entity always gets same point ID across runs

Phase 2: Mark old database-based vectorization queue functions as DEPRECATED
- Added deprecation warnings to ai_config_routes.py:
  * process_vectorization_queue() - DEPRECATED
  * process_vectorization_queue_internal() - DEPRECATED
  * process_tenant_vectorization_queue() - DEPRECATED
  * process_vectorization_batch() - DEPRECATED
  * bulk_vectorize_entities_from_queue() - DEPRECATED
- Added deprecation header explaining migration to RabbitMQ-based architecture
- Kept create_text_content_from_entity() as ACTIVE (used by new worker)

Benefits:
- VectorizationWorker now uses same AI infrastructure as old ETL
- Consistent embedding generation across old and new ETL
- Consistent Qdrant storage format and point IDs
- Clear deprecation path for old database queue approach
- Maintains backward compatibility during transition

Next Steps:
- Test vectorization worker with real data
- Remove deprecated functions after full migration
- Update documentation to reflect new architecture

Add statuses to vectorization queue for Jira extraction

Transform Worker Updates:
- Added vectorization queueing for statuses after insert operations
- Added vectorization queueing for statuses after update operations
- Queues statuses by external_id (same pattern as projects and wits)

Vectorization Worker Updates:
- Fixed Status entity data preparation to use 'original_name' field
- Added 'external_id' to status entity data for better tracking
- Maintains consistency with Status model schema

AI Config Routes Updates:
- Added specific text content handler for 'statuses' table
  * Format: 'Name: {original_name} | Category: {category} | Description: {description}'
- Added specific text content handler for 'projects' table
  * Format: 'Key: {key} | Name: {name} | Description: {description} | Type: {project_type}'
- Added specific text content handler for 'wits' table
  * Format: 'Name: {name} | Description: {description}'
- Improved text content generation for better embedding quality

Current Vectorization Coverage:
âœ… projects (by key)
âœ… wits (by external_id)
âœ… statuses (by external_id) - NEW

Pending Implementation:
âŒ work_items (Phase 2.3 - Issues/Changelogs/Dev Status)
âŒ changelogs (Phase 2.3)
âŒ GitHub entities (prs, prs_commits, prs_reviews, prs_comments, repositories)
âŒ work_items_prs_links (requires both Jira + GitHub)

Testing:
- Run Jira extraction job
- Verify statuses are queued for vectorization
- Check Qdrant collection: client_{tenant_id}_statuses
- Verify qdrant_vectors bridge table has status records

Fix vectorization timing issue and reduce excessive logging

Issue 1: Entity Not Found Errors
- Root cause: Vectorization messages were queued BEFORE database commit
- Transform worker was calling _queue_entities_for_vectorization() inside
  _process_statuses_data() before the transaction was committed
- Vectorization worker would try to fetch entities that didn't exist yet

Fix:
- Modified _process_statuses_data() to return entities instead of queueing
- Returns: {'count': X, 'statuses_to_insert': [...], 'statuses_to_update': [...]}
- Moved vectorization queueing to AFTER db.commit() in parent function
- Ensures entities are persisted before vectorization messages are published

Issue 2: Excessive WARNING Logs
- 'Entity not found' warnings were flooding logs
- 'Message processing failed' warnings were also excessive
- These are expected when entities are queued before commit (race condition)

Fix:
- Changed VectorizationWorker 'Entity not found' from WARNING to DEBUG
- Added helpful comment: 'may have been queued before commit'
- Changed BaseWorker 'Message processing failed' from WARNING to DEBUG
- Added helpful comment: 'entity may not exist yet'

Flow After Fix:
1. Transform worker processes entities
2. Bulk insert/update to database
3. db.commit() - entities now persisted
4. Queue vectorization messages - entities guaranteed to exist
5. Vectorization worker fetches entities successfully

Benefits:
- Eliminates race condition between commit and vectorization
- Reduces log noise significantly
- Maintains proper transaction boundaries
- Vectorization worker only processes committed entities

Testing:
- Run Jira extraction
- Verify no 'Entity not found' warnings in logs
- Verify vectorization completes successfully
- Check Qdrant collections have all expected vectors

Fix vectorization worker session management and remove deprecated code

Issue: VectorizationWorker was failing with 'No suitable provider available'
Root Cause: HybridProviderManager was initialized with a session that became
stale/closed when reused across multiple messages, preventing it from querying
the Integration table for AI provider configs.

Solution: Implement separate session management (Option 2)
- Each operation (fetch entity, generate embedding, store in Qdrant, store bridge)
  now creates its own fresh database session
- Removed cached _hybrid_provider and _qdrant_client instance variables
- Each message processing creates fresh HybridProviderManager and PulseQdrantClient
- Ensures proper session lifecycle and prevents stale session issues

VectorizationWorker Changes:
- Removed __init__ caching of _hybrid_provider and _qdrant_client
- Refactored process_message() to use 4 separate session scopes:
  * Session 1: Fetch entity and prepare data
  * Session 2: Generate embedding (created inside _generate_embedding)
  * Session 3: Store in Qdrant (no DB session needed)
  * Session 4: Store bridge record in qdrant_vectors table
- Updated _generate_embedding() signature: removed session param, added tenant_id
  * Creates fresh session internally for HybridProviderManager
  * Initializes providers with fresh session that can query Integration table
- Updated _store_in_qdrant() to create fresh PulseQdrantClient each time
- Updated _get_point_id() signature: accepts record_id instead of entity object

Deprecated Code Removal:
- Removed ALL deprecated database-based vectorization queue endpoints:
  * /ai/vectors/process-queue
  * /ai/vectors/process-queue-internal
  * /ai/vectors/cleanup-queue
  * /ai/vectors/cleanup-failed-queue
  * /ai/vectors/cleanup-qdrant
- Removed deprecated helper functions:
  * process_tenant_vectorization_queue()
  * process_vectorization_batch()
  * bulk_vectorize_entities_from_queue()
  * cleanup_old_completed_records()
  * cleanup_completed_records_immediately()
- Removed deprecated Pydantic models:
  * VectorizationQueueRequest
  * VectorizationCleanupRequest
  * VectorizationFailedCleanupRequest
  * QdrantCleanupRequest
- Reduced ai_config_routes.py from 2308 lines to 1138 lines (50% reduction)

Kept Active Code:
- create_text_content_from_entity() - STILL USED by VectorizationWorker
- All AI provider management endpoints
- All integration configuration endpoints

Benefits:
- Fixes 'No suitable provider available' error
- Proper service-to-service authentication flow
- Each operation gets fresh session with proper scope
- No stale session issues
- Cleaner codebase with 1170 lines of deprecated code removed
- VectorizationWorker now fully operational with AI Gateway integration

Testing:
- Run Jira extraction
- Verify embeddings are generated successfully
- Check logs for successful vectorization
- Verify Qdrant collections have vectors
- Verify qdrant_vectors bridge table has records

Fix duplicate function definition in ai_config_routes.py

Removed duplicate create_text_content_from_entity function definition
that was causing IndentationError on startup.

Fix AI providers to use new Integration settings JSON schema

Updated HybridProviderManager, WEXGatewayProvider, and SentenceTransformersProvider
to extract configuration from integration.settings JSON field instead of accessing
old schema fields (ai_model, ai_model_config, cost_config).

Fixes: Integration object has no attribute ai_model error

Refactor qdrant_vectors table to use IntegrationBaseEntity and add source_type for multi-agent architecture

Changes:
1. Model Updates (unified_models.py):
   - Changed QdrantVector to inherit from IntegrationBaseEntity instead of Base
   - Removed embedding_model and embedding_provider columns (now in integration)
   - Added source_type column for agent filtering ('JIRA', 'GITHUB')
   - Added integration relationship to get embedding config
   - Follows correct column order: id, business columns, then BaseEntity fields

2. Migration Updates (0001_initial_db_schema.py):
   - Updated qdrant_vectors table schema to match new model
   - Added source_type column for multi-agent architecture
   - Added integration_id FK to integrations table
   - Added IntegrationBaseEntity fields (integration_id, tenant_id, active, created_at, last_updated_at)
   - Added indexes:
     * idx_qdrant_vectors_source_type (tenant_id, source_type) - agent filtering
     * idx_qdrant_vectors_point_id (qdrant_point_id) UNIQUE - reverse lookups
     * idx_qdrant_vectors_active (tenant_id, active) - active filtering

3. Worker Updates (vectorization_worker.py):
   - Added SOURCE_TYPE_MAPPING constant for agent scope:
     * JIRA: work_items, changelogs, projects, statuses, workflows, wits, wits_prs_links
     * GITHUB: prs, prs_commits, prs_reviews, prs_comments, repositories, dora_*
   - Updated process_message() to extract integration_id from entity
   - Updated _store_bridge_record() to:
     * Accept integration_id parameter
     * Map table_name to source_type using SOURCE_TYPE_MAPPING
     * Remove embedding_model and embedding_provider (now in integration)
     * Use IntegrationBaseEntity fields (integration_id, active)
     * Auto-generate created_at and last_updated_at

Benefits:
- Cleaner schema: embedding config stored once in integrations table
- Multi-agent support: source_type enables agent-specific queries
- Better traceability: integration_id links to exact embedding config used
- Consistent with other tables: follows IntegrationBaseEntity pattern
- Optimized queries: indexes for agent filtering and reverse lookups

Fix migration: remove old qdrant_vectors indexes referencing removed columns

Issue: Migration failed with 'column embedding_provider does not exist'

Root Cause: Old index creation code (lines 1348-1361) was trying to create
indexes on removed columns (embedding_provider) from the old schema.

Solution: Removed duplicate/obsolete index creation code since proper indexes
are already created earlier in the migration (lines 711-720):
- idx_qdrant_vectors_source_type (tenant_id, source_type)
- idx_qdrant_vectors_point_id (qdrant_point_id) UNIQUE
- idx_qdrant_vectors_active (tenant_id, active)

The old indexes being removed:
- idx_qdrant_vectors_tenant (redundant with source_type index)
- idx_qdrant_vectors_table_record (not needed)
- idx_qdrant_vectors_collection (not needed)
- idx_qdrant_vectors_point_id (already created as UNIQUE above)
- idx_qdrant_vectors_provider (column removed)

Suppress Qdrant version compatibility warning

Issue: UserWarning about Qdrant client version 1.15.1 being incompatible
with server version 1.11.0 (minor version difference exceeds 1)

Solution: Added check_compatibility=False to QdrantClient initialization
to suppress the warning. The version difference is not critical for our
current usage (both are 1.x major version).

Note: Consider upgrading Qdrant server to 1.15.x in the future to match
client version and access latest features.

Upgrade Qdrant server to v1.15.1 to match Python client version

Issue: Qdrant client version 1.15.1 incompatible with server version 1.11.0
(minor version difference of 4 exceeds maximum allowed difference of 1)

Solution: Upgraded Qdrant Docker image from v1.11.0 to v1.15.1 to match
the Python client library version.

Changes:
- docker-compose.yml: Updated qdrant image to qdrant/qdrant:v1.15.1
- Reverted check_compatibility=False workaround

Next Steps:
- Run: docker-compose down
- Run: docker-compose up -d
- This will recreate Qdrant container with matching version

Update Qdrant version in docker-compose.db.yml to v1.15.1

Missed updating docker-compose.db.yml in previous commit.
Both docker-compose.yml and docker-compose.db.yml now use Qdrant v1.15.1
to match Python client library version.

Fix migration 0002 rollback: delete qdrant_vectors before integrations

Issue: Rollback failed with foreign key constraint violation when trying
to delete integrations that are still referenced by qdrant_vectors table.

Solution: Added deletion of qdrant_vectors records before deleting
integrations in the rollback function.

Order of deletion in rollback:
1. custom_fields
2. qdrant_vectors (NEW - must be before integrations)
3. integrations
4. tenants_colors
5. tenants

Add validation for integration_id in VectorizationWorker

Added explicit check to ensure integration_id exists before attempting
to store bridge record. All vectorized tables (JIRA and GITHUB) inherit
from IntegrationBaseEntity and have integration_id, but this validation
provides better error messages if something goes wrong.

This prevents foreign key constraint violations when storing to
qdrant_vectors table.

Update documentation for multi-agent vectorization architecture

Updated ETL.md and AI.md to reflect the new multi-agent vectorization system:

ETL.md changes:
- Updated vectorization stage description with tenant-specific queues
- Added multi-agent architecture features (source_type filtering)
- Updated vectorization message format to match actual implementation
- Added note about HybridProviderManager and integration-based config

AI.md changes:
- Added Multi-Agent Architecture section with SOURCE_TYPE_MAPPING
- Added agent query patterns for Jira Agent, GitHub Agent, Master Agent
- Added complete qdrant_vectors bridge table schema documentation
- Added index documentation for multi-agent queries
- Updated title to reflect multi-agent architecture

Key concepts documented:
- Source type classification (JIRA, GITHUB)
- Agent-specific vector filtering
- Bridge table for PostgreSQL â†” Qdrant mapping
- Integration-based embedding configuration
- Tenant isolation with dedicated collections

fix: Resolve ETL job execution issues and clean up logging

Major Fixes:
1. Fixed duplicate job execution caused by race conditions
2. Fixed WebSocket reconnection spam on token refresh
3. Cleaned up excessive browser console logs
4. Reduced backend log file growth by 90%

ETL Job Execution Fixes:
- Added atomic database updates to prevent race conditions between manual and automatic triggers
- Implemented job completion wait logic in timer loop to prevent premature re-triggering
- Added fallback delay calculation when next_run is in past (uses schedule_interval_minutes)
- Enhanced logging with clear indicators (MANUAL TRIGGER vs AUTO TRIGGER)
- Added timezone verification logging for debugging

WebSocket Improvements:
- Fixed: WebSocket connections no longer reconnect on token refresh (every 4 minutes)
- WebSocket authentication happens only at connection time (handshake)
- Existing connections remain alive during token refresh
- Only reconnect on: logout, network drop, or explicit disconnect
- Eliminates false status updates and progress bar glitches

Frontend Logging Cleanup:
- Removed all success console.log statements (token refresh, WebSocket init, etc.)
- Only errors are logged to browser console
- Clean, professional, production-ready console output

Backend Logging Improvements:
- File handler now logs WARNING+ only (was INFO+)
- Added smart filter for critical events (job lifecycle, triggers, errors)
- Log rotation: 10MB max, 5 backups (~50MB total)
- Reduced log file growth from ~1-2 MB/hour to ~100-200 KB/hour

UI Improvements:
- Countdown timer now pauses (shows 'â€”') when job is running
- No more countdown ticking during job execution

Files Modified:
- services/backend-service/app/main.py
- services/backend-service/app/core/logging_config.py
- services/backend-service/app/etl/jobs.py
- services/backend-service/app/etl/job_scheduler.py
- services/backend-service/app/etl/jira_extraction.py
- services/backend-service/dev_server.py
- services/backend-service/restart_backend.bat
- services/etl-frontend/src/components/JobCard.tsx
- services/etl-frontend/src/services/websocketService.ts
- services/etl-frontend/src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx

Testing:
- Verified no duplicate job executions
- Verified WebSocket stays connected during token refresh
- Verified clean browser console (errors only)
- Verified reduced backend log file growth

## Pull Request Overview This PR introduces "New ETL Jira 3", which appears to be the third iteration of ETL improvements focused on Jira integration and vectorization architecture. The changes modernize the ETL pipeline with RabbitMQ-based vectorization, improved authentication, and enhanced custom field mapping capabilities. ### Key Changes: - **RabbitMQ Vectorization Architecture**: Replaced database-based vectorization queue with RabbitMQ messaging for better scalability and tenant isolation - **Enhanced Custom Field Mapping**: Added new API endpoints and UI components for mapping Jira custom fields to database columns - **Authentication & Security Improvements**: Updated WebSocket authentication to require JWT tokens and improved token masking in logs ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 82 out of 83 changed files in this pull request and generated 7 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | services/etl-frontend/src/types/index.ts | Added CustomField interface for new custom field mapping system | | services/etl-frontend/src/services/websocketService.ts | Updated WebSocket service to require authentication tokens and handle initialization properly | | services/etl-frontend/src/services/etlApiService.ts | Added new API methods for custom field mapping table operations | | services/etl-frontend/src/pages/CustomFieldMappingPage.tsx | Complete rewrite to use new custom field mapping APIs with improved table-based UI | | services/backend-service/app/workers/ | Added VectorizationWorker and updated WorkerManager to handle both transform and vectorization workers | | services/backend-service/app/etl/queue/queue_manager.py | Added vectorization queue support with tenant-specific queues | | services/backend-service/app/models/unified_models.py | Updated QdrantVector model and renamed WitPrLinks to WorkItemPrLink for consistency |
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.
The 'legacy' comments suggest these methods are deprecated but they're still being exported and used. Consider adding @deprecated JSDoc tags or a clear migration plan in the comments.
The 'legacy' comments suggest these methods are deprecated but they're still being exported and used. Consider adding @deprecated JSDoc tags or a clear migration plan in the comments.

This comment indicates a dependency on initialization order between AuthContext and HomePage. Consider making this dependency more explicit or adding a check to verify the service is initialized before use.
Creating fresh instances for each message may impact performance under high load. Consider implementing connection pooling or instance reuse with proper cleanup to improve efficiency.

[nitpick] The comment 'Include for queueing' is unclear about why this field is specifically needed. Consider explaining what queueing operation requires this field.
```suggestion
                        'external_id': wit_external_id,  # Required for downstream queue consumers to identify WITs for update operations
```

The error handling silently continues after failing to set up the vectorization queue, which could lead to message publishing failures. Consider making this a critical error or implementing retry logic.

The token masking logic may still expose sensitive information if tokens are shorter than expected. Consider using a fixed mask length or more secure masking pattern regardless of token length.
```suggestion
        # Mask token for logging (never reveal any part of the token)
        masked_token = "****MASKED****"
```

fix: Complete ETL project-WIT relationship creation

CRITICAL FIX: Resolved missing automatic project-WIT relationship creation in ETL pipeline

## Problem Solved
- ETL jobs were completing successfully but not creating project-WIT relationships
- Persistent 'too many values to unpack (expected 2)' errors in backend logs
- Only 5 manually created relationships vs expected 80+ automatic relationships

## Root Cause
Multiple problematic functions with tuple unpacking errors:
1. Old _create_project_wit_relationships(db, projects_data) function
2. Problematic bulk_insert_relationships call in _perform_bulk_operations
3. Deprecated _create_project_wit_relationships(session, project_wit_relationships) function

## Solution
- Fixed createmeta data processing to extract relationships correctly from 'issuetypes' field
- Replaced all problematic relationship creation with working _create_project_wit_relationships_for_search function
- Added proper error handling and defensive tuple unpacking
- Removed/cleaned up all disabled and deprecated functions
- Cleaned up unused imports and debug files

## Results
- âœ… Relationships count: 5 â†’ 86 (automatic creation working)
- âœ… Zero 'too many values to unpack' errors in logs
- âœ… ETL jobs running smoothly with proper relationship creation
- âœ… Duplicate prevention working correctly
- âœ… All 12 projects now have correct issue type relationships (5-9 per project)

## Files Modified
- services/backend-service/app/workers/transform_worker.py: Fixed relationship creation logic
- Removed debug files: debug_raw_data.py, test_project_search.py

ETL system now 100% functional with automatic project-WIT relationship creation!

Fix ETL Jira job endpoint distinction

- Updated backend-service Jira extraction to use /project/search for automatic jobs
- Distinguished /createmeta (manual custom fields sync) vs /project/search (automatic ETL jobs)
- Fixed data structure handling for project/search response format
- Updated memory documentation to clarify endpoint usage
- ETL job now working correctly with proper foreign key relationships

Update ETL documentation to clarify Jira endpoint usage

- Added clear distinction between /project/search (automatic ETL jobs) and /createmeta (manual custom fields sync)
- Updated Phase 2 sections to specify which endpoint is used for each operation
- Clarified that createmeta is user-triggered while project/search is job scheduler triggered
- Added data structure differences (values vs projects, issueTypes vs issuetypes)
- Documented corresponding transform function usage for each endpoint

## Pull Request Overview This PR implements the ETL transformation evolution plan and completes Phase 3-6 of the AI query interface, transforming the Pulse Platform into an AI-powered operating system for software development. The implementation includes natural language query processing, detailed ETL phase planning, ML training infrastructure, and essential infrastructure updates. - **AI Query Interface (Phase 3-6)**: Complete natural language query processing with semantic, structured, and hybrid routing capabilities - **ETL Evolution Planning**: Comprehensive 4-phase plan to transform monolithic ETL into microservices architecture - **ML Training Infrastructure**: Advanced ML operations with data drift detection, adaptive scheduling, and performance optimization - **Docker Infrastructure**: RabbitMQ integration for message queue-based ETL processing ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 21 out of 21 changed files in this pull request and generated 7 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | story_point_model.sql | ML training view and model creation for story point prediction | | data_readiness_check.sql | ML training data assessment and readiness validation | | main.py | Integration of AI query routes in backend service | | ai_query_routes.py | Complete natural language query API endpoints | | query_processor.py | Core AI query processing engine with hybrid routing | | report_2025_09.md | Documentation of Phase 3-6 AI query interface completion | | updated_architecture_overview.md | ETL transformation architecture documentation | | etl_phase_4_testing_production.md | Production deployment and testing plan | | etl_phase_3_frontend_migration.md | Frontend migration to new ETL APIs | | etl_phase_2_etl_service_refactor.md | ETL service refactoring plan | | etl_phase_1_backend_etl_module.md | Backend service ETL module implementation | | archive_greenfield_etl_implementation_plan.md | Complete greenfield ETL implementation plan | | archive_greenfield_etl_architecture.md | Detailed ETL architecture blueprint | | archive_code_cutover_plan.md | Step-by-step code migration plan | | README.md | ETL transformation overview and implementation guide | | ai_phase_3-6_ai_agent_foundation.md | Updated completion status for AI query interface | | ai_phase_4-3_smart_ml_optimization.md | Advanced ML optimization with data drift detection | | ai_phase_4-2_automated_ml_training.md | Automated ML training job implementation | | ai_phase_4-1_manual_ml_training.md | Initial manual ML model training plan | | docker-compose.yml | RabbitMQ service integration | | docker-compose.db.yml | Database-only Docker configuration with RabbitMQ |
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.
The hardcoded tenant ID '1' should be parameterized to support multi-tenant training. Consider using a placeholder or variable that can be substituted during execution.
The hardcoded project name with tenant ID '1' should be parameterized to support multi-tenant deployments. Consider using a template or variable substitution approach.
The hardcoded project name with tenant ID '1' should be parameterized to support multi-tenant deployments. Consider using a template or variable substitution approach.

The string interpolation of tenant_id directly into the SQL query instruction could potentially be exploited. Consider using parameterized queries or additional validation to ensure tenant_id is properly sanitized.
```suggestion
            # Validate tenant_id is an integer to prevent injection
            try:
                safe_tenant_id = int(tenant_id)
            except (ValueError, TypeError):
                raise ValueError("Invalid tenant_id provided; must be an integer.")
            # Use AI to generate SQL query
            prompt = f"""Convert this natural language query to SQL for a PostgreSQL database:
Query: "{query}"

Available tables: work_items, prs, prs_comments, projects, users
All tables have tenant_id column for filtering.
IMPORTANT: Always include 'WHERE tenant_id = {safe_tenant_id}' in your queries.
```
String concatenation for SQL query construction is vulnerable to SQL injection. Use parameterized queries with proper escaping instead of concatenating the LIMIT clause.

The backup command should include error handling and verification. Consider adding `--verbose` flag and checking the exit status to ensure backup completion before proceeding with deployment.
```suggestion
BACKUP_FILE="backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).sql"
docker exec pulse-postgres pg_dump --verbose -U postgres pulse_db > "$BACKUP_FILE"
if [[ $? -ne 0 || ! -s "$BACKUP_FILE" ]]; then
  echo "âŒ Database backup failed or file is empty. Aborting deployment."
  exit 1
fi
```
The magic number 0.001 for avoiding log(0) should be defined as a named constant (e.g., `EPSILON = 0.001`) to improve code readability and maintainability.

## Pull Request Overview This pull request adds a new vectorization card component and Qdrant database page while significantly improving the UI/UX across admin pages with enhanced styles, filters, and consistent notification systems. Key changes include: - New reusable vectorization card component for table-specific vectorization operations - New Qdrant database page for vector database management - Enhanced UI styles for improved card hover effects, table interactions, and consistent toggle switches - Updated CSS with unified styling for cards, tables, and navigation elements ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 32 out of 33 changed files in this pull request and generated 5 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | services/etl-service/static/js/vectorization-card.js | Implements reusable vectorization card component with progress tracking | | services/etl-service/static/css/etl-service.css | Adds universal card hover effects, enhanced table UX, and unified styling | | services/etl-service/app/templates/workflows.html | Integrates vectorization card and improves toggle switches | | services/etl-service/app/templates/wits_mappings.html | Adds vectorization card and enhanced filter system | | services/etl-service/app/templates/wits_hierarchies.html | Integrates vectorization card with improved UI consistency | | services/etl-service/app/templates/statuses_mappings.html | Adds vectorization card and modern notification system | | services/etl-service/app/templates/integrations.html | Improves action buttons and adds filter functionality | | services/etl-service/app/templates/home.html | Enhances job management with better error display and orchestrator controls |
Comments suppressed due to low confidence (1) **services/etl-service/static/css/etl-service.css:1** * The CSS class 'font-xs' should be 'text-xs' to follow standard utility naming conventions. ``` /* Pulse ETL Service - Enterprise Design System */ ```
--- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

The select element should include an accessible label association using 'for' attribute on the label element or 'aria-labelledby' on the select element for screen readers.
```suggestion
                <label for="workflowIntegration" class="block text-sm font-medium mb-2" style="color: var(--text-primary);">Integration</label>
```

The filter references 'mapping.source_type_name' but the table displays 'mapping.wit_from'. This property mismatch will cause the filter to fail.
```suggestion
        if (sourceTypeFilter && !mapping.wit_from.toLowerCase().includes(sourceTypeFilter)) {
```

The filter references 'mapping.target_type_name' but the table displays 'mapping.wit_to'. This property mismatch will cause the filter to fail.
```suggestion
        if (targetTypeFilter && !mapping.wit_to.toLowerCase().includes(targetTypeFilter)) {
```

The method signature still requires auth_token as a positional parameter. Consider making it optional with a default value of None to maintain true backward compatibility while indicating the parameter is deprecated.

The retry_count is incremented but then the job is marked as FINISHED. Consider implementing a maximum retry limit before marking as FINISHED, or clearly document that this is intentional behavior for single-attempt failures.
